author: Nebiyu
title: Cardano Student Clubs in Ethiopia
description: A Vast majority of the Ethiopian youth have never even heard of cardano and there is no active and engaged community.

assessments.note: The proposal describes how it will grow the number of students that will learn about Cardano, but doesn't go any further, in explaining how that will translate in the growing of the Cardano community and most importantly into their growth. What are their possibilities afterwards to make use of their knowledge? How will it help, what will they be able to do?
the proposal has clear goals which are aligned with the challenge's goals. Bringing awareness and deep-dive forums to university hits right where adoption is needed.

Good proposal that is well laid out and seems reasonable in addressing the challenge. It is very localised in the short term which is ok especially if a winning formula can be achieved by the team for a single university that can then be applied elsewhere.

What a great way to expose Ethiopian youth to Cardano and engage them in the existing community and encourage community building. If successful the model could work all over the world.  This proposal if successful could have a huge impact on the challenge goals.

I give a 5 for impact because working with college students is an extremely effect way to address the challenge question of expanding Cardano in Africa. This proposal provides detail on how to complete their project and how it adds to Cardano through education and engagement around blockchain technology. They begin their project by focusing on one university but can scale to other universities within Ethiopia (and it could scale into other countries if they are successful with expansion within the country). There are several clear metrics about the number of people to be involved and events to be held. They even plan to evaluate their workshops to make improvements for the next one.
The presented plan is relatively simple thus likely to be implemented.

The plan is well described and has most of the information needed. However, it doesn't have a further purpose beyond the growth of college students learning about Cardano and how that could impact their life. And this is a question that needs to be answered in order for the project to be successfully implemented as that is the same question that those students might also ask themselves: "Why should I devote my time to learning about this, if I don't see how that would help me further along the way?"
The proposal has a clear set of scope, timeline as well as budget. the group can also benefit from cashflow generated by the apparel sales.

There is a lot to like about the proposal and overall I think the team would make a reasonable attempt with their experience and the plan provided. The budget seems too high although most of that is for phase 2 of the proposal. I feel phase 1 up and running followed by phase 2 in a subsequent proposal would be far greater at finding success.

The proposer has a technical background and  works with Addis Ababa University.  With some motivation and enthusiasm this vision seems entirely feasible. It seems as if it wouldn't take long for some students to become involved and help carry the weight of the project. A highly detailed timeline for the project has been produced, as well as a plan for financial sustainability.

This project appears 5/5 feasible because the budget is detailed and realistic and they provide a very specific calendar for completing steps of the project. Their recruitment efforts are wise and will make all the difference in expansion/scalability. However, "risks" are not addressed; there is a blank header on their google doc, so I reduce the score to 4.

The proposal has covered a lot of details. Yet there must be more attached to it, then just venues where students can go, listen to someone talk, have a snack, get a T-Shirt and then go back home, and soon forget about it all.

the proposal sets for a clear timeline, budget and scope which gives it a clear place to audit success from. The only thing that could be improved is being more explicit with the goal to on board new Cardano wallets.

The information provided is very good, the plan is well mapped although the details of certain aspects are lacking. I would like to see further proof of materials to be used in education of students, examples of flyers etc. Again reiterate that asking for significant funds without greater detail makes it difficult to assess higher at this stage.

19.35k is not a small amount but the funding is broken down in great detail in the attached document. While difficult to audit in exact terms, it should be easy to see if the project has momentum by the end of phase 1.  I would have suggested that the proposal only request funds for phase 1 to have more chances of success. If results were positive it should be easy to acquire more funding in future rounds. If you do not get the vote this time, I suggest you take that approach in future Catalyst funds.
The proposal provides dozens of KPIs so auditing for success should be straightforward. The problem and solution they propose is clear. Their roadmap is detailed.

solution: A cardano students club and ambassadorship program will enable students to learn from each other and increase engagement in the community.
experience: Nebiyu is a backend developer and currently working with the Addis Ababa university on student and Alumni relations development.
